multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Neurology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Ask different questions to cover more information. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I've been feeling irritable, restless, and I've been hearing voices.
How long have you been experiencing these symptoms?
I have been experiencing these symptoms for about a year.
Do you have any family history of mental health issues?
Yes, my father committed suicide at the age of 50.
Have you been diagnosed with any psychiatric conditions or are you currently taking any medication?
I have a history of depression for the past 2 years.
Are the voices you hear consistently derogatory or telling you to do things?
I hear multiple episodes of hearing voices, but I didn't specify their nature or what they tell me.

I started hearing voices over the past year, around the same time I started experiencing difficulties at work and eventually lost my job.
Final Diagnosis: Schizophrenia.
